summary: Add Stream View as alternate visualization for Blackboard tab
context: The Blackboard tab only has a plain data table, unlike Decisions (Timeline) and Graph (Visual). Blackboard data is fundamentally a multi-agent conversation with 10 entry types, relates_to links, and scope hierarchy — all flattened into rows.
rationale: A vertical card-based activity stream best fits the conversational nature of blackboard data. Cards colored by entry type, grouped by time, with CSS thread lines for relates_to connections. Visually distinct from Timeline (horizontal time bands) and Graph (node network). Scales well for dozens-to-hundreds of entries kept active by archival.

alternatives.option: Scope Heatmap + Swimlanes — grid with rows as scopes and columns as time buckets
alternatives.reason_rejected: More abstract, loses individual entry readability, scope paths don't form clean hierarchy, needs more interaction to reach actual entries

alternatives.option: Constellation Map — node layout like graph tab but for blackboard entries positioned by time/scope
alternatives.reason_rejected: Overlaps with what Graph tab already does, would feel redundant, more complex to build with good UX
